etymologies: mid 19th century. From German Aegirin from Aegir, the name of the sea god in Scandinavian mythology + -in

definitions: An iron-containing mineral of the clinopyroxene group which is characteristic of many alkaline igneous rocks; also called aegirite.

notes.text: Aegirine is a silicate of sodium and ferric iron, NaFeiiiSi₂O₆, and typically occurs as dark green crystals. Crystal system: monoclinic.
